Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as an attempt to introduce censorship under the guise of protecting the community from harm.
The bill gives excessive power to the government to impose fines on social media platforms for not removing content deemed as misinformation or disinformation.
There is a lack of clarity on who within ACMA would decide what content should be censored.
The definitions of misinformation and disinformation in the bill are identical, which contradicts widely accepted definitions.
The legislation could potentially be used to censor political opinions, particularly those opposing the government's stance.
The bill is viewed as a threat to free speech and democratic discussion, reminiscent of Orwellian dystopia.
Notable Quotes: The proposed legislation / amendments represent a blatant attempt by the Albanese / ALP federal government to introduce censorship.

The legislation amendments are a very concerning attempt to limit free speech in this nation and even to curtail or roll back the 200+ year history of Australian governance under the Westminster System.
The bad news is that dystopian vision appears to be happening now with the attempt to foist the 'combatting misinformation and disinformation' bill on the public.
